intro: Primula rosea subsp. rosiflora, commonly known as the pink primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep rose. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and oval, dark green leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and meadows. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a touch of color to the landscape during the transition from winter to summer.
